title: Ed Sheeran pinches richest British celebrity under 30 title from Adele
text:
Ed’s now the richest celeb under 30

Ed Sheeran can afford to pop some very expensive bottles of champagne as he’s been named Britain’s richest celebrity under 30.

It really is all down to the numbers as the Thinking Out Loud singer only reached the spot thanks to Adele turning 31 in May.

Heat magazine have released their annual list of the richest musicians, movie stars and TV personalities and, basically, we know who we’ll be hitting up for Christmas presents this year.

Ed, 28, has seen his value almost double since 2018 as his fortune has reportedly jumped from £94 million to £170 million. He was number two last year but Adele aging gracefully has allowed him to take the crown.

It’s believed the bulk of Ed’s income has stemmed mostly from his mammoth Divide tour, which saw him perform 258 shows to seven million fans over two and a half years from March 2017 until August 2019. In total, it grossed an estimated $776.2 million (£599.4 million).

Ed also rakes in the coins from publishing royalties thanks to his songwriting credits, which have helped him shift 150 million records worldwide for himself and other artists like Justin Bieber, Anne-Marie and Rita Ora.

Congrats on, well, being rich, Ed.

Daniel Radcliffe is still earning from Harry Potter (Picture: Rex Features)

Stormzy is the highest new entry (Picture: WireImage)

Dua Lipa is also a new entry on the list (Picture: PA)

Amber is named the most bankable Love Island star (Picture: Getty Images)

Although it shouldn’t come too much of a surprise as earlier this year, it was reported that Ed was well on his way to becoming a billionaire by the age of 30.

Taking this year’s second place is Daniel Radcliffe who has an estimated fortune of £90m thanks to his never-ending stream of Harry Potter earnings.

One Direction star Harry Styles is in third place with £64 million, with his yearly increase largely down to his solo career. The Sign of the Times hitmaker raked in an estimated £12 million from his tour, which took place across 2017 and 2018. Harry also has a lucrative deal with Gucci worth a cool £8 million.

Big For Your Boots rapper Stormzy is the highest new entry at number 14, with healthy earnings of £12 million following his record-breaking Glastonbury headline set this summer.

Popstar Dua Lipa has also made her debut on the list at number 15 with £11.8 million while Game of Thrones star Maisie Williams ranks at number 25 with £4.5 million.

The magazine also compiled a list of the most bankable Love Island stars with Amber, 23, claiming the number one spot thanks to her £1 million contract with MissPap and other endorsement deals including Littlewoods and Topshop.

Molly-Mae Hague, 20, is in second place followed by her boyfriend Tommy Fury.

Across the pond, Kylie Jenner has been named the world’s wealthiest young star under the age of 30 with £736 million.
